name: Roasted Ratatouille
description: Classic Ratatouille vegetables (eggplant, zucchini, bell peppers, garlic and more) are roasted together in the oven until they become tender and flavorful. An easy recipe on hand to use up all your Summer produce!
recipeIngredient: 2  medium zucchini, cut into half moons
1  large onion, cut into small wedges
3  medium tomatoes, cut into wedges or chunks
1  red bell pepper, cut into strips or squares
1  yellow bell pepper, cut into strips or squares

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F and line a large baking pan with parchment paper or a silicone mat.
recipeInstructions.name: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F and line a large baking pan with parchment paper or a silicone mat.

recipeInstructions.text: Spread the eggplant, zucchini, onion, garlic cloves, tomatoes and peppers evenly on the prepared pan. Drizzle the olive oil over the vegetables and stir gently to mix. Sprinkle with thyme and salt.
recipeInstructions.name: Spread the eggplant, zucchini, onion, garlic cloves, tomatoes and peppers evenly on the prepared pan. Drizzle the olive oil over the vegetables and stir gently to mix. Sprinkle with thyme and salt.

recipeInstructions.text: Roast for 45-60 minutes, stirring occasionally until tender and browned.
recipeInstructions.name: Roast for 45-60 minutes, stirring occasionally until tender and browned.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove from oven and toss with the basil and balsamic vinegar. Serve and enjoy! This dish is good hot or cold, with fresh bread or even pasta.
recipeInstructions.name: Remove from oven and toss with the basil and balsamic vinegar. Serve and enjoy! This dish is good hot or cold, with fresh bread or even pasta.
